nodes.text: People call me Stanwell. I run the caravan between Redding and the New California Republic. Brahmin for gold. Can usually use an extra hand or two. We leave town on the 11th day of every month. If you want to sign on, make sure you're here then.
That wasn't too bad at all. Here's your $2000. Come on back if you need more work sometime.
Did you really think that I'd reward a thief? You're lucky I didn't lynch you on the trail. I'm certainly not paying you anything. Now get out.
We trade NCR's best brahmin for gold ore in Redding. Straight and simple - just the way I like  things.
Well, you got free eats and a safe trip here. Now get out of here, you moron.
We didn't quite lose everything we had...but we lost more than I can afford. If you'd done your job right, you'd be getting more than this $500.
Get the hell out of here. You should know better.
You came along at a good time. We're ready to go right now. The job pays $2000. Ready to join us?
We got so torn up out there that I don't have enough money to pay you. Of course, if you'd done your job better, things would be different.
That was a good run. Might not have worked out that way if you weren't along. Here's your $2000, plus a $500 bonus for the great job. Thanks again.
We're usually looking for caravan guards but, like I said, we won't be ready to go until the 11th of the month. If you still want a job with us, come back then.
You know what I think about your kind. Just get out of my sight.
Sorry, pal, we've already got enough throwbacks working in this caravan.
We need to get the brahmin in from the outlying settlements before we can get going. We'll be ready to move early on the 11th. Stop back on then if you want a job.

links.text: I don't think that's for me. Goodbye.
I don't think I ever want to spend so much time looking at the ass-end of a brahmin again. Goodbye.
A thief? I resemble that remark, you damn ingrate. I'm leaving. Goodbye.
Let me ask you something else.
Gotcha. You said you're looking for guards?
Let me ask you something else.
Well, something is better than nothing, I guess. Goodbye.
I can come up with better ways to spend my time than eating brahmin dust all day. Goodbye.
Sounds great. I'm ready. Let's go.
I don't think that's for me. Goodbye.
You cheap bastard! You'll pay for stiffing me. Goodbye.
Nice to find someone who appreciates quality when he sees it. See you around, maybe. Goodbye.
What did you say you usually transport?
